Class SocketServerHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Network.Socket.Client.SocketServerHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualServer, Remote
public class SocketServerHandler extends Object implements VirtualServer
SocketServerHandler is a class responsible for handling socket-based server communication in a multiplayer game environment. It serves as an implementation of the VirtualServer interface, facilitating client-server interactions by managing player states, game actions, and client connections. This class handles various game-related operations such as setting player readiness, starting a game, picking and discarding components, manipulating tiles on the game board, flipping hourglasses, activating cards, and more. It also manages the connection state of players and the communication between the client and server via sockets.

      public SocketServerHandler(OutputStream os) throws IOException

      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while creating the ObjectOutputStream.

      public void checkAvailability(String nickname)
      Sends a request to check the availability of the specified nickname. This method constructs a `SocketMessage` object with the "checkAvailability" command and sends it to the output stream using the `objectOutput`.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname to be checked for availability

    • weldComponentTile

      public void weldComponentTile(String nickname, int i, int j, int numOfRotations)
      Sends a command to weld a component tile at a specified position on a game board, with a specified number of rotations. The method prepares the input command, wraps it in a socket message, and transmits it to the server for processing.
      Specified by:
      weldComponentTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player performing the action
      i - the row position of the component tile to be welded
      j - the column position of the component tile to be welded
      numOfRotations - the number of clockwise rotations to apply to the component tile before welding

      Specified by:
      standbyComponentTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player or entity for which the component tile should be set to standby

    • finishedAllShipboards

      public void finishedAllShipboards()
      Notifies that all shipboards have been completed and sends the relevant notification via a socket connection to the connected client(s). This method creates a new `SocketMessage` instance with the command "finishedAllShipboards" and sends it through the `objectOutput` stream. If an IOException occurs during the communication process, an error message is printed to the standard output.
      Specified by:
      finishedAllShipboards in interface VirtualServer

    • flipHourglass

      public void flipHourglass()
      Sends a command to flip the hourglass in a connected socket-based system. This method creates a `SocketMessage` object with the "flipHourglass" command and sends it through the `objectOutput` stream to notify the remote system. In case of an I/O error, the method catches and logs the exception. The method is overridden to provide specific functionality for handling the "flipHourglass" operation within the context of the implemented interface or superclass.
      Specified by:
      flipHourglass in interface VirtualServer

      pickCard in interface VirtualServer

      Specified by:
      connect in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      client - The client's virtual view instance, which enables server-client communication.
      nickname - The nickname of the client trying to establish a connection.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects the current connection by sending a "disconnect" message through the output stream. This method communicates the intent to terminate the connection to the other end of the socket. If an I/O error occurs while attempting to send the disconnect message, the error is logged to the console with a descriptive message.
      Specified by:
      disconnect in interface VirtualServer

      b - an integer parameter representing an index that is set into the input command for testing

      public String getVirtualServerType()

    • connectToServerTUI

      public static SocketServerHandler connectToServerTUI(String[] args, ClientModel clientModel, Scanner scanner, EnhancedClientView enhancedClientView) throws InterruptedException, ClassNotFoundException
      Establishes a connection to the server using the provided arguments and initializes various components for the client-side of the application. This method facilitates user interaction via the terminal user interface (TUI) and allows the user to join the server lobby.
      Parameters:
      args - The command-line arguments, where the first element should be the server host and the second element should be the server port.
      clientModel - The data model representing the client's state.
      scanner - An instance of Scanner to handle user input via the terminal.
      enhancedClientView - The view component responsible for rendering enhanced client-side interactions.
      Returns:
      A SocketServerHandler representing the connection to the server, or null if the connection fails.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - If the current thread is interrupted while waiting.
      ClassNotFoundException - If a serialized class cannot be found during object deserialization.

    • connectToServerGUI

      public static SocketServerHandler connectToServerGUI(String host, int port, String name, ClientModel clientModel, GalaxyTruckerGUI view) throws InterruptedException
      Establishes a connection to the server using the provided parameters and integrates it with the GUI. The method attempts to connect to the server, verify the availability of the player's nickname, and handles server responses for different scenarios. If successful, sets up a new client-side socket and starts interaction with the server.
      Parameters:
      host - The hostname or IP address of the server to connect to.
      port - The port number on the server to connect to.
      name - The nickname of the player to be used in the game.
      clientModel - A reference to the client model which contains the game's state and logic.
      view - A reference to the GUI for the client to display and manage interaction messages.
      Returns:
      A SocketServerHandler object to facilitate server communication if the connection is successful; otherwise null.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - If the thread executing the connection is interrupted during the process.
